strapiPost.title: New Restaurant Brings Authentic Southeast Asian Cuisine to Downtown Rogers
strapiPost.content:
House 1830, a culturally authentic Southeast Asian restaurant featuring dishes from Vietnam, Laos, and Thailand, opens today in Downtown Rogers.

Home Cooked: Named after the owners’ childhood home, House 1830 serves a menu of quintessential dishes from Vietnam, Laos, and Thailand. The menu will rotate with the seasons to recreate an authentic eating experience of Southeast Asian cuisine the way it was meant to be eaten.

Looks tasty: Get a sneak peek at some menu items on the restaurant’s Facebook, like Banh Xeo, a Vietnamese curry crepe with seasoned shrimp and pork filling, and Goi Nem Nuong rolls. They’ve also teased some signature drink items like the coffee-based Yok Lho and a refreshing Ka Chiep tea.

Reservation only until September as the team finds its rhythm, providing consistent quality service. Make your reservation HERE.
